text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Business" means a commercial entity that provides locksmith services.
"Employee" means an individual employed by a licensed locksmith to provide locksmith services on behalf of the licensed locksmith.

"Fixed business address" means a single physical location where a licensee conducts business and at which the licensee or an employee of the licensee is available:
during normal business hours; or
other hours as provided in the application for the license.
"License" means a license issued by the Secretary to provide locksmith services.
"Licensed locksmith" means, unless the context requires otherwise, a business that is licensed by the Secretary to provide locksmith services.

"Local law enforcement unit" means the Department of State Police, a police department in the State, or sheriff in the State:
designated by the county or municipal governing body for a licensee with an in-State fixed business address; or
designated by the Secretary for a licensee with an out-of-state fixed business address.

"Provide locksmith services" means to engage professionally and for compensation in:
repairing, rebuilding, rekeying, repinning, recombinating, adjusting, or installing mechanical, electrical, or electromechanical locking devices, safes, vaults, or safe deposit boxes; or
operating a mechanical, electrical, or electromechanical locking device or opening safes, vaults, or safe deposit boxes by a means other than that intended by the manufacturer of such locking devices.
